00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  * @brief   Binary tree implementation.
00003  *
00004  * Methods for working with Arrow's binary tree data structure.
00005  *
00006  * @author  John LaRusic
00007  * @ingroup lib
00008  ****************************************************************************/
00009 #include "common.h"

00011 /****************************************************************************
00012  * Private function prototypes
00013  ****************************************************************************/
00014 /**
00015  *  @brief  Constructs a new node structure with the given value.
00016  *  @param  node [out] pointer to node structure
00017  *  @param  value [in] value to assign to new node
00018  */
00019 int
00020 construct_node(arrow_bintree_node **node, int value);
00021 
00022 /**
00023  *  @brief  Frees the memory of the given node and its child nodes.
00024  *  @param  node [out] node structure
00025  */
00026 void
00027 destruct_node(arrow_bintree_node *node);
00028 
00029 /**
00030  *  @brief  Inserts a given value into the tree at the given node, or one of
00031  *          its child nodes.
00032  *  @param  tree [in] pointer to tree structure
00033  *  @param  node [out] pointer to node structure
00034  *  @param  value [in] value to assign to new node
00035  */
00036 int
00037 insert_at(arrow_bintree *tree, arrow_bintree_node *node, int value);
00038 
00039 /**
00040  *  @brief  Recursive helper function to fill an array in nondecreasing order.
00041  *  @param  node [out] pointer to an node structure
00042  *  @param  array [out] array to fill
00043  *  @param  pos [out] current position in array
00044  */
00045 void
00046 fill_array(arrow_bintree_node *node, int *array, int *pos);

00048 
00049 /****************************************************************************
00050  * Public function implementations
00051  ****************************************************************************/
00052 void
00053 arrow_bintree_init(arrow_bintree *tree)
00054 {
00055     tree->size = 0;
00056     tree->root_node = NULL;
00057 }
00058 
00059 void
00060 arrow_bintree_destruct(arrow_bintree *tree)
00061 {
00062     if(tree->size > 0)
00063         destruct_node(tree->root_node);
00064     free(tree->root_node);
00065     tree->root_node = NULL;
00066     tree->size = 0;
00067 }
00068 
00069 int
00070 arrow_bintree_insert(arrow_bintree *tree, int value)
00071 { 
00072     int ret;
00073 
00074     if(tree->size == 0)
00075     {
00076         arrow_bintree_node *new_node;
00077         ret = construct_node(&new_node, value);
00078         tree->root_node = new_node;
00079         tree->size++;
00080     }
00081     else
00082     {
00083         ret = insert_at(tree, tree->root_node, value);
00084     }
00085 
00086     return ret;
00087 }
00088 
00089 void
00090 arrow_bintree_to_array(arrow_bintree *tree, int *array)
00091 {
00092     int pos = 0;
00093     fill_array(tree->root_node, array, &pos);
00094 }
00095 
00096 int
00097 arrow_bintree_to_new_array(arrow_bintree *tree, int **array)
00098 {
00099     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(tree->size, array))
00100         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00101     arrow_bintree_to_array(tree, *array);
00102     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00103 }

00106 /****************************************************************************
00107  * Private function implementations
00108  ****************************************************************************/
00109 int
00110 construct_node(arrow_bintree_node **node, int value)
00111 {
00112     if((*node = malloc(sizeof(arrow_bintree_node))) == NULL)
00113     {
00114         arrow_print_error("Error allocating memory for arrow_bintree_node.");
00115         node = NULL;
00116         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00117     }
00118     
00119     (*node)->data = value;
00120     (*node)->has_left_node = ARROW_FALSE;
00121     (*node)->has_right_node = ARROW_FALSE;
00122     (*node)->left_node = NULL;
00123     (*node)->right_node = NULL;
00124     
00125     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00126 }
00127 
00128 void
00129 destruct_node(arrow_bintree_node *node)
00130 {
00131     if(node->has_left_node == ARROW_TRUE)
00132     {
00133         destruct_node(node->left_node);
00134         free(node->left_node);
00135         node->left_node = NULL;
00136     }
00137     if(node->has_right_node == ARROW_TRUE)
00138     {
00139         destruct_node(node->right_node);
00140         free(node->right_node);
00141         node->right_node = NULL;
00142     }
00143 }
00144 
00145 int
00146 insert_at(arrow_bintree *tree, arrow_bintree_node *node, int value)
00147 {
00148     int ret;
00149     arrow_bintree_node *new_node;
00150     
00151     /* Check for duplicate value */
00152     if(node->data == value)
00153     {
00154         return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00155     }
00156     /* Insert to the left of this node */
00157     else if(node->data > value)
00158     {
00159         if(node->has_left_node == ARROW_FALSE)
00160         {
00161             ret = construct_node(&new_node, value);
00162             if(ret == ARROW_FAILURE)
00163                 return ret;
00164             node->left_node = new_node;
00165             node->has_left_node = ARROW_TRUE;
00166             tree->size++;
00167             return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00168         }
00169         else
00170         {
00171             return insert_at(tree, node->left_node, value);
00172         }
00173     }
00174     /* Insert to the right of this node */
00175     else
00176     {
00177         if(node->has_right_node == ARROW_FALSE)
00178         {
00179             ret = construct_node(&new_node, value);
00180             if(ret == ARROW_FAILURE)
00181                 return ret;
00182             node->right_node = new_node;
00183             node->has_right_node = ARROW_TRUE;
00184             tree->size++;
00185             return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00186         }
00187         else
00188         {
00189             return insert_at(tree, node->right_node, value);
00190         }
00191     }
00192 }
00193 
00194 void
00195 fill_array(arrow_bintree_node *node, int *array, int *pos)
00196 {
00197     if(node->has_left_node)
00198         fill_array(node->left_node, array, pos);
00199     array[*pos] = node->data;
00200     (*pos)++;
00201     if(node->has_right_node)
00202         fill_array(node->right_node, array, pos);
00203 }
